predicate.note: Frames file for 'refile' based on minimal modification of 'file' file.

roleset.name: paperwork

example.name: active
example.text: David Dinkins failed *trace* to refile his income taxes.

example.name: lawsuit
example.text: University Patents refiled a suit in federal court in Philadelphia against Albert M. Kligman.

roleset.note: Sometimes the against phrase is included in the suit phrase. You'll therefore need to delve deeper into the syntax to divide the two args.

example.name: passivized
example.text: Documents refiled *trace* with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the pending spinoff...

roleset.note: This happens a lot, with something that looks (syntactically) like an argument of "refile" but is actually a modifier of the head NP--really --this is "documents on the pending spinoff were refiled with the SEC" --but the syntax has been bollixed. Use ArgM for all these.

example.name: with purpose
example.text: A group of investors refiled with federal antitrust regulators for clearance to buy more than 50% of the stock of Rally's Inc.
example.arg: clearance to buy more than 50% of the stock of Rally's Inc

roleset.name: seek, claim, call for

example.text: One or more airlines have refiled for protection from creditors.

roleset.note: The difference between this and the Arg-4 "purpose" is that in this case the paperwork cannot be mentioned. With the roleset id="refile.03" above, the paperwork need not be mentioned, but can be. Other arguments (refiled-with, refiled-against) will probably be mentioned.
